safety_objection.objection: Motorcycles are too dangerous / My wife says it's a death wish
safety_objection.wrong_approach: It's not that dangerous if you're careful
safety_objection.right_approach: You're right to take safety seriously - that's actually the sign of someone who'll be a good rider. Let me show you what responsible riders do: MSF course, proper gear, defensive riding techniques. The riders who get hurt are usually the ones who skip these steps. We require our customers to take the safety course, and we won't let you leave without proper gear. Your family will see you're doing this the right way.
safety_objection.psychology: Validate the concern, align with their protective instinct, show the dealer cares about safety too

spouse_objection.objection: My spouse is against this / I need to convince my partner
spouse_objection.wrong_approach: Just do it anyway - it's your life
spouse_objection.right_approach: Bring them in. Let's talk together about what makes this safe and manageable. Often, spouses are worried because they don't understand it - once they see the safety measures, meet other riders, and maybe even sit on a bike themselves, they get it. Some of our best customers are couples who ride together now. Would [SPOUSE] come in this weekend?
spouse_objection.psychology: Include the spouse, make them part of the solution, show this can strengthen the relationship

cost_objection.objection: It's too expensive / I can't afford this right now
cost_objection.wrong_approach: We can get you financed no matter what
cost_objection.right_approach: Let's talk about what fits your budget. You don't need the biggest, newest bike to have an amazing experience. Some of our happiest riders started on used bikes or smaller models. What matters is getting you on two wheels. Let's look at [BUDGET-FRIENDLY OPTIONS] and see what works. You can always upgrade later - most riders do.
cost_objection.psychology: Remove shame, offer legitimate alternatives, show a path to yes

experience_objection.objection: I've never ridden before / I'm too old to learn / I'm not coordinated enough
experience_objection.wrong_approach: Anyone can do it - it's easy
experience_objection.right_approach: That's exactly why the MSF course exists. I've seen 60-year-olds who've never ridden pass that course and become confident riders. It's designed for people exactly like you. And we'll start you on a bike that's manageable - not something that'll intimidate you. The fact that you're nervous actually means you'll be cautious and thoughtful, which makes you safer than someone overconfident.
experience_objection.psychology: Reframe their caution as an advantage, provide clear learning path, normalize being a beginner

commitment_objection.objection: I need to think about it / I want to shop around more
commitment_objection.wrong_approach: This deal won't be here tomorrow
commitment_objection.right_approach: Absolutely - this is a big decision. What specific questions do you still have? What are you comparing us to? I'd rather you take your time and feel confident than rush and have regrets. Here's what I can tell you: we'll be here, we'll honor our prices for [TIMEFRAME], and if you find something better elsewhere, come talk to me first. Fair?
commitment_objection.psychology: Remove pressure, build trust, make it safe to return, show confidence in value

timing_objection.objection: Maybe next year / I'll wait until [SEASON/EVENT]
timing_objection.right_approach: I get it - timing matters. But here's what I've learned from 20 years of selling bikes: there's never a 'perfect' time. There's always something. What I don't want is for you to look back next year and wish you'd started today. If timing is really the issue, let's figure out what would make now work. If it's truly not possible, I respect that - but let's make sure it's not just fear talking.
timing_objection.psychology: Gentle confrontation of avoidance, reality check, offer to problem-solve

skill_progression_objection.objection: What if I outgrow this bike quickly / What if I want something bigger
skill_progression_objection.wrong_approach: Then you'll just buy another one
skill_progression_objection.right_approach: Great question - you're thinking ahead. Here's the truth: most riders keep their first bike for 1-3 years. We have an excellent trade-in program, and starter bikes hold value well because there's always new riders looking for them. Starting on the right bike for your skill level isn't wasting money - it's investing in becoming a good rider. Riders who start too big often get scared and quit. Let's get you riding safely, and when you're ready to upgrade, we'll take care of you.
skill_progression_objection.psychology: Validate forward thinking, show the progression is normal and planned for, emphasize safety over ego

maintenance_objection.objection: I don't know how to maintain a motorcycle / What if something breaks
maintenance_objection.wrong_approach: It's easy - you'll figure it out
maintenance_objection.right_approach: That's exactly why you buy from a dealer, not Craigslist. We service everything we sell. You'll get a maintenance schedule, we'll walk you through what to watch for, and you can bring it here for anything. We also offer service plans that cover scheduled maintenance. You're not in this alone - we want you riding, not wrenching, unless that's your thing.
maintenance_objection.psychology: Position dealer relationship as the solution, remove technical intimidation, offer ongoing support

pricing_psychology.anchoring: Display MSRP prominently, then show dealership price as savings. For used bikes, show original new price, current market value, then your price.
pricing_psychology.bundle_advantage: Never sell bike alone‚Äîalways present with gear package option. '$12,999 bike' vs '$12,999 bike + $800 gear for $13,499' makes gear feel discounted.
pricing_psychology.payment_framing: Lead with monthly payment on premium bikes ($299/month feels smaller than $15,999), lead with total price on budget bikes (emphasize value).
pricing_psychology.scarcity_triggers: '1 of 2 in this color' or 'Last 2024 model' creates urgency without false scarcity. For service: 'Only 3 Saturday slots left this month.'
pricing_psychology.tiered_pricing: Always show three options‚Äîentry model, mid-tier (most popular), premium. Customers avoid extremes and choose middle, which should be your target sale.
